publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4414 Dr Sylvia Jackson: Recognising Scotland’s Volunteers Providing Overseas Aid—That the Parliament recognises the significant work carried out by the people of Scotland in providing help and support to poorer countries and, in particular, congratulates all those individuals, local groups, churches and charities from the Stirling constituency, encouraged by the Scottish Executive, for providing assistance to countries such as Malawi.

S2M-4414 Recognising Scotland’s Volunteers Providing Overseas Aid (lodged on 17 May 2006) Mr John Swinney*, Jackie Baillie*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Maureen Macmillan*, Trish Godman*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Bristow Muldoon*, Mike Pringle*, Michael McMahon*, Tommy Sheridan*, Karen Gillon*, Dave Petrie*, Murdo Fraser*, Cathie Craigie*, Donald Gorrie*, Helen Eadie*, Patrick Harvie*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Bill Butler*

S2M-4414 Dr Sylvia Jackson: Recognising Scotland’s Volunteers Providing Overseas Aid—That the Parliament recognises the significant work carried out by the people of Scotland in providing help and support to poorer countries and, in particular, congratulates all those individuals, local groups, churches and charities from the Stirling constituency, encouraged by the Scottish Executive, for providing assistance to countries such as Malawi. Supported by: Mr John Swinney, Jackie Baillie, Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Trish Godman, Rob Gibson, Mr Jim Wallace, Ms Sandra White, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Bristow Muldoon, Mike Pringle, Michael McMahon, Tommy Sheridan, Karen Gillon, Dave Petrie, Murdo Fraser, Cathie Craigie, Donald Gorrie, Helen Eadie, Patrick Harvie, Marilyn Livingstone, Bill Butler, Des McNulty*
S2M-4414 Recognising Scotland’s Volunteers Providing Overseas Aid (lodged on 17 May 2006) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-4414 Recognising Scotland’s Volunteers Providing Overseas Aid (lodged on 17 May 2006) Mr Jamie Stone*

S2M-4414*#* Dr Sylvia Jackson: Recognising Scotland’s Volunteers Providing Overseas Aid—That the Parliament recognises the significant work carried out by the people of Scotland in providing help and support to poorer countries and, in particular, congratulates all those individuals, local groups, churches and charities from the Stirling constituency, encouraged by the Scottish Executive, for providing assistance to countries such as Malawi. Supported by: Mr John Swinney, Jackie Baillie, Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Trish Godman, Rob Gibson, Mr Jim Wallace, Ms Sandra White, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Bristow Muldoon, Mike Pringle, Michael McMahon, Tommy Sheridan, Karen Gillon, Dave Petrie, Murdo Fraser, Cathie Craigie, Donald Gorrie, Helen Eadie, Patrick Harvie, Marilyn Livingstone, Bill Butler, Des McNulty, Irene Oldfather, Mr Jamie Stone, Eleanor Scott*
